image.altText: A man applies a paperbark splint to a woman's ankle

props.synopsis: Lying on the ground with her ankle snapped in half in the remote bushland of western Arnhem Land, her mind racing, and with no help or phone reception, Margie Moroney began to crawl.

title.children: Woman survives 500-metre crawl with broken ankle in remote Arnhem Land

image.altText: An airline's blue and red logo can be seen painted on the tail of a large commercial plane.

props.synopsis: Direct flights between Darwin and China have resumed for the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic, bringing optimism of a tourism boom for the two countries.

title.children: Hopes new Darwin-to-China flights will bring down domestic airfares

image.altText: A building painted in black and brown reads: NAAJA.

props.synopsis: The North Australian Aboriginal Justice Agency says hundreds of people are likely being held on remand in Northern Territory jails "unlawfully and unconstitutionally".

title.children: Lawyers launch High Court challenge to 'unconstitutional' NT bail laws

image.altText: A child wearing a bike helmet, smiling at the camera and pointing at the gap where his baby teeth have fallen out.

props.synopsis: An Alice Springs teenager who grew up with cycling program Bikes Mwerre is now sharing his knowledge with the next generation. It's a full-circle moment for the outback program built on pride, skills and belonging.

title.children: Outback bike program celebrates four years of teaching the next generation

image.altText: A young woman in Santa hat and swimsuit looks at the ocean under blue skies

props.synopsis: It is just a few sleeps until Christmas Day, and the weather is promising a mixed bag for Australia's capital cities. Here is what to expect.

title.children: What the weather will bring in your capital city on Christmas Day

image.altText: Woman in an Australia post high visibility top is sorting the mail and smiling

props.synopsis: A disability enterprise is partnering with Australia Post to deliver mail to Aboriginal town camps around Alice Springs.

title.children: Meet the Alice Springs disability enterprise delivering mail to town camps

image.altText: Close-up of Australia's five, 10, 20, 50 and 100 dollar bills.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is down on Christmas Eve, despite the value of US stocks, gold and silver climbing to their most expensive levels ever, while the Australian dollar has jumped to its highest level since October 2024. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie dollar jumps to 14-month high, ASX falls as gold and silver hit record highs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Consumer and financial sectors drag ASX lower
ASX falls 0.3 per cent in early trade
US consumers turn pessimistic as inflation, tariffs and interest rates weigh on mood

image.altText: Liberal MP Katie Allen, wearing a rainbow scarf, smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Former federal Liberal MP Katie Allen has died aged 59, after developing a rare form of cancer, her family has announced.

title.children: Former federal Liberal MP Katie Allen dies aged 59

image.altText: A man with long black-grey hair and sunglasses walks through a crowd.

props.synopsis: The British comedian now faces seven charges of sexual assault involving six separate women.

title.children: Russell Brand charged with another two sex offences including rape

image.altText: ABC's AM presenter Sabra Lane smiling

props.synopsis: Sabra Lane is farewelling the ABC's AM after nine years of hosting the current affairs radio program.

title.children: ABC radio host Sabra Lane farewells AM after nine years

image.altText: A map of Australia on Tuesday showing a cyclone in the top left and a void of any cloud on the west coast.

props.synopsis: Perth, and much of WA, is enduring a severe Christmas heatwave with extreme fire danger, while Tropical Cyclone Grant intensifies offshore.

title.children: Severe Christmas heatwave grips WA as cyclone intensifies offshore

image.altText: A man stands behind a counter with christian figurines on the side and in shelves behind him.

props.synopsis: For the first time in two years, Bethlehem has restarted its Christmas festivities to "reignite the spirit that everybody needs" while Palestinians continue to live under restrictions.

title.children: Christmas festivities return to Bethlehem after two years as Palestinians hope for a 'better future'

image.altText: A website profile headshot of a man in suit jacket and tie smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A high-flying Australian financier accused of swindling a struggling Vietnamese petroleum trading company has been languishing in a Ho Chi Minh City cell for two months.

title.children: Australian businessman held without charge in Vietnamese jail

image.altText: Gennaro Rapinese and Candice

props.synopsis: Battling acute myeloid leukaemia, Gennaro Rapinese finally found a suitable bone marrow donor on the other side of the world in the US. And, after making a full recovery, he got to thank her in person in the lead-up to Christmas.

title.children: US student spends Christmas with Perth man after saving his life

image.altText: two men in christmas outfits in snow

props.synopsis: Which Christmas hits didn't do as well on the charts as you'd think? Test your knowledge of festive cheer.

title.children: Quiz: Do you know how to make the gravy? Test your Christmas song knowledge

image.altText: an illustration of the house shows sun light being captured and pushed into the living room where a family sits

props.synopsis: On December 24, 1948, a family of Hungarian refugees moved into a small house in Dover, Massachusetts.  But there was a catch.

title.children: 'She Trapped the Sun': Inside the world's first solar house

image.altText: A woman and a black labrador dog stand in front of a vast outback landscape

props.synopsis: Moolooloo station, nestled in South Australia's Flinders Ranges, might look like your typical outback farm, but the workforce at this station has one unique addition — a black labrador called Mika.

title.children: Seeing eye dog Mika is helping station owner navigate life on the land

image.altText: The exterior of a Commonwealth Bank branchm including the brand's logos.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth Bank of Australia will refund low-income earners receiving Centrelink payments approximately $68 million in unfair fees — just over a quarter of what was charged.

title.children: CommBank customers to receive $68m in refunds for incorrect bank fees

image.altText: A smiling woman sitting at a desk.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of trying to murder her ex-husband before fleeing to Palau has made a bid in South Australia's Supreme Court for release on bail.

title.children: Woman accused of trying to kill ex allegedly searched for 'hit men'

image.altText: An older man holding a newspaper open.

props.synopsis: The Buloke Times, the "heartbeat of the community", has a new owner after being in one family's hands for more than a century.

title.children: 150-year-old newspaper with a 95yo editor gets new owner

image.altText: A red sign that says "sale" in white writing is placed on a display rack of shoes.

props.synopsis: Boxing Day spending is expected to hit a record high, supported by revived household spending after three interest rate cuts.

title.children: Australians tipped to spend record $1.6b on Boxing Day sales

image.altText: Dark cloud over land in the outback.

props.synopsis: It may not be the most welcome weather at the beach, but out in the west, rain is the best Christmas gift.

title.children: Flood watch for north-west Qld, but rain 'best Christmas gift'

image.altText: overhead photo of sticks of cinnamon and three bowls containing yellow powder, fennel seeds, and round seeds, star anise.

props.synopsis: Australia's medicine watchdog has issued another safety alert for contaminated Ayurvedic medicines. So what do consumers need to know about this multi-million-dollar industry?

title.children: Some Ayurvedic medicines aren't safe to consume. Here's what to look for

image.altText: A man in a red shirt and cap holds a few raspberries in his hand as he stands in front of canes.

props.synopsis: Christmas is usually a boom time for Tasmanian berry producers, but this year's cold spring has slowed crops and hurt profits.

title.children: Christmas boom on hold as berries, cherries ripen too late

image.altText: A collage of photos of a man in a hospital bed on oxygen next to him smiling in high vis on a stair case

props.synopsis: Johnnie Tumai is preparing to spend his first Christmas at home since receiving a new set of lungs. He's urging others to register as donors this festive season.

title.children: Truckie Johnnie’s double-lung transplant the best ever ‘Christmas gift’

image.altText: The Olympics rings with a mountain in the background

props.synopsis: The head of the FIS has raised concerns over snow and financial issues affecting the Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games, suggesting that a radical rotation system of hosts should be considered.

title.children: World ski boss proposes radical Olympic Games rotation system

image.altText: The England cricket team huddle up before a day's play

props.synopsis: ECB managing director Rob Key will investigate reports England's recent break in Noosa resembled a "stag do" as the tourists pick up the pieces from their Ashes defeat.

title.children: England to investigate Duckett video as Noosa investigation looms

image.altText: Two tennis players, one man with a cap on and one woman in yellow, shake hands at the end of a game.

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kygrios's match marketed under the "Battle of the Sexes" banner makes a mockery of first era-defining match between Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs.

title.children: 'Belittling of women's tennis': New 'Battle of the Sexes' a lose-lose

image.altText: NOLb_SperTobacco_1107

props.synopsis: Illicit tobacco retailers have racked up millions in unpaid fines since the introduction of stronger penalties in Queensland, with one owing more than $7 million.

title.children: Six illicit tobacco operators rack up millions of dollars in unpaid fines

image.altText: Greenland lies at a strategic point between Russia and the USA.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump appoints a special envoy to Greenland, drawing renewed criticism from Denmark and the territory's leader over Washington's interest in the mineral-rich Arctic island.

title.children: Trump sparks Denmark's anger by appointing US envoy to Greenland

image.altText: Mike Doustdar and David Ricks listen as Donald Trump speaks.

props.synopsis: A daily weight-loss pill will soon be available in the US, after the regulator gave approval to Danish drug company Novo Nordisk's oral version of the popular injectable, Wegovy.

title.children: Pill version of injectable weight-loss drug Wegovy approved by US regulator

image.altText: A greying man and blonde woman seen standing in mugshots on a striped wall while wearing orange prison jumpsuits.

props.synopsis: Authorities say Colorado funeral home operators Carie and Jon Hallford gave fake ashes to some families of the dead.

title.children: Judge accepts guilty pleas for US couple accused of abusing 191 corpses

image.altText: Freed students  pose for photographs upon their arrival at the government house

props.synopsis: Nigerians get their first look at 130 children and teachers released after being seized in one of the largest mass abductions in the country's history.

title.children: Nigerians welcome schoolchildren and teachers released after mass abduction

image.altText: A Samoan woman holds a bar with weights on either end above her head and smiles.

props.synopsis: Last month Samoan weightlifters Seine Stowers and June Sipaia broke World and Oceania records. Their success is due to a generational shift in attitudes to women in the sport, and a world-class facility at home.

title.children: These women are showing the world why Samoa is a weightlifting powerhouse
